column4: does any1 know how i can get firefox to play streaming media?
what media player do you use?  there are also ways to get totem to play imbeded media that work well.
i use totem at the moment but will change to any that lets me play the streams
look for a firefox extension called MediaPlayerConnectivity.  It will allow you to play web imbeded media in your media player outside of your browser.
where you have a grey box will turn into a box that you click on which will play it in your media player.
also, if you would rather keep the media embeded while using totem, this guide shows you how to set that up.  http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=17727&highlight=totem+embeded

hey it seems to work but i get this error No URI handler implemented for "mms://a1319.v03264.c326.g.vm.akamaistream.net/7/1319/326/42837b1d/bmgent.download.akamai.com/326/rcarecords.com/foo_fighters/audio/best_of_you_96.wma"
well, unfortunately linux doesnt handle windows media too well.  especially the newer stuff.  i dont know how to help you with that.
you probably just need the codecs.
are you using the w32codecs from the repository?  if you are then you need to make sure you are using totem-xine rather than just regular totem.
yea ive got the win32 codec's
those will only work with totem-xine.
